column4: hey guys is there going to be any way to use the bbc iplayer with linux
I think its awesome that you can go and download the shows but can't do it if you have linux
try bittorrent,  all the best bbc shows end up there
you just need to go to a site that shows  wmv avi or mpg  videos
google for  realplayer linux and dl the .bin installer, very easy
ok,    open the terminal,  cd to the fodler with the file in it ,  then type   sudo chmod 777 fiklename.bin ,  then  sudo ./filename.bin
sudo ./filename.bin    read carefully   it's sudo dotslachfinename.bin
you are replacing filename with the actual name of the file right ?
put a path in the home folder   like  /home/user/.realplayer
what do i put in for the prefix for symbolic links
I hve no idea, it never asked me for that when I installed  leave the default if there is any
I hve no idea, it never asked me for that when I installed  leave the default if there is any
congrats
does bbc radio one work on yours
never tried but the little previews usualy do
have a nice time
just log off ,
try with synaptic if that doesn'T work    delete the flash files and folder from your hdd,   use the search engine in the places  menu and make sure you select to view hidden files as well
enable all the repost,  mustliver and backport as well,  then just search for flash
oh, don'T think it is in the dapper repos you'll hve to get the one from the adobe site
clean iinstall is quiicker by a long shot,
